content.description:
Climbs the right-leaning shallow corner system with the hardest moves at the bottom. Useful as a downclimb as well.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the west face.

content.description:
Fun slabby moves up solid patina edges to a finishing jug at the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the south face.

content.description:
Grab the sloping lip and make a devious mantle over the top.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
East face of the boulder and just right of

Baltic Thunder

.

content.description:
Balance up the smooth slab starting with a high-step onto an edge at the start.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the west face.

content.description:
SDS at the featured arete and work up and left with holds continually appearing just where you need them. The problem passes over a rock midway so a spot can be useful.

A variation to this is to rockover onto the slab midway and finish up

Moonglow

.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: The northwest arete of the boulder.

content.description:
Make a highstep (or hop) into a dish and work up the slanting arete which gets steeper as well as better the higher you go. Take care not to fall back onto the yucca at the start!

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Left of

Golden Monkey

on the southwest arete.

content.description:
Climbs thin edges up the slabby patina face with a few long reaches involved.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Balancy moves up the arete lead to a interesting sloping topout.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: The southeast arete of the boulder.
